title: Recognize the Standard Equation
text: The equation is in the form of $$x^2+y^2=r^2$$ which is the standard form of a circle with center at origin. In this case $$r=7$$. Therefore the equation represents the circle with radius $$7$$.\n##figure1.gif##
speech: The equation is in the form of  x squared plus y squared, is equal to, r squared  which is the standard form of a circle with center at origin. In this case  r, is equal to 7 . Therefore the equation represents the circle with radius  7 .\n##figure1.gif##
pacedSpeech: The equation is in the form of   x squared plus y squared, is equal to, r squared
which is the standard form of a circle with center at origin. In this case   r, is equal to 7
. Therefore the equation represents the circle with radius   7
